title: Nearly Ten Million Americans Have Filed For Unemployment In The Last Two Weeks
description:
More than six million people filed for unemployment last week, on top of the 3.3 million claims the week prior. Analysts project the share of Americans out of work could go as high as 15 percent this year.

This episode: congressional correspondent Susan Davis, chief economics correspondent Scott Horsley, and reporter Danielle Kurtzleben.

itunes:title: Nearly Ten Million Americans Have Filed For Unemployment In The Last Two Weeks
itunes:author: NPR
itunes:summary: In this episode, the NPR team talks through the lastest weekly unemployment numbers report and what the government is doing to help those out of work.
